info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 6 at 10:08AM EDT until April 7 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Grand Rapids MI
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Grand Rapids MI has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Michigan...
Maple River at Maple Rapids affecting Clinton County.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Maple River at Maple Rapids.
* WHEN...From this afternoon to tomorrow evening.
* IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, Expect minor flooding of County Line Road and a home along County Line Road.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:15 AM EDT Sunday the stage was 9.0 feet. - Bankfull stage is 7.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 9.0 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 9.0 feet on 04/25/1999. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/grr.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO TOMORROW EVENING
